page.title: 12Whipsnade Zoo
page.content: Whipsnade Zoo was opened in 1931 by the Zoological Society as the country branch of London Zoo.It is built on 600 acres of farmland & houses about 2000 animals which include elephants, dolphins,giraffes,hippos,big cats, bears,camels,chimpanzees,birds and many other species.They are cared for by about 40 keepers together with over 60 technical,adminstrative & ancillary workers of which about a quarter live locally.The park,which is visited by an average of 380,000 people each year is divided into large enclosures giving plenty of space for herds of antelope,deer & rhinos.There is a Children's Zoo containing ponies, goats,rabbits & other small animals. The Society's aims are the introduction of new & curious species, conservation,and improvement of animal husbandry.
